questions.question: Why was Mathilde unhappy with her life?

options.text: She wanted luxuries she could not afford

questions.answer: She wanted luxuries she could not afford

questions.question: What job did Loisel do?

options.text: Minor clerk in the Ministry of Education

questions.answer: Minor clerk in the Ministry of Education

questions.question: Why did visiting Madame Forestier make Mathilde sad?

options.text: She envied her wealth and comforts

questions.answer: She envied her wealth and comforts

questions.question: What event changed Mathilde’s routine life?
questions.answer: The party invitation

questions.question: Why did Mathilde throw the invitation on the table?

options.text: She had nothing suitable to wear

questions.answer: She had nothing suitable to wear

questions.question: How much money did Mathilde ask for her dress?
questions.answer: Four hundred francs

questions.question: What was Loisel planning to buy with his savings?
questions.answer: A hunting gun

questions.question: Why did Mathilde borrow jewellery?

options.text: It was required by the rules
She wanted to look elegant and admired

questions.answer: She wanted to look elegant and admired

questions.question: From whom did Mathilde borrow jewellery?
questions.answer: Madame Forestier

questions.question: What jewellery did Mathilde select?
questions.answer: A diamond necklace

questions.question: Why couldn’t the couple find a cab after the party?
questions.answer: It was very late

questions.question: What did Mathilde discover after reaching home?
questions.answer: The necklace was missing

questions.question: What lie did the couple tell Forestier?

options.text: The clasp broke and it was being repaired

questions.answer: The clasp broke and it was being repaired

questions.question: How much did the replacement necklace cost?
questions.answer: Thirty-six thousand francs

questions.question: Why did Loisel age quickly?

options.text: The stress of debt and extra work

questions.answer: The stress of debt and extra work

questions.question: What change occurred to Mathilde after ten years?
questions.answer: She became old and worn

questions.question: Where did Mathilde meet Madame Forestier again?
questions.answer: On the Champs Élysées

questions.question: What secret did Mathilde finally reveal?

options.text: She had lost the original and replaced it

questions.answer: She had lost the original and replaced it

questions.question: What shocking fact did Forestier reveal?

options.text: She had lost her jewels too

questions.answer: Her necklace was imitation

questions.question: Which theme is central to the story?

options.text: Pride and desire lead to suffering

questions.answer: Pride and desire lead to suffering

questions.question: Why didn’t Mathilde enjoy her real life?
questions.answer: She always dreamed of luxury

questions.question: Which quality does Loisel show?
questions.answer: Sacrifice

questions.question: Why was the new lifestyle painful for Mathilde?
questions.answer: Heavy labor and poverty

questions.question: How did the couple repay debt?

options.text: Through long years of hard work

questions.answer: Through long years of hard work

questions.question: What does the story show about appearances?

options.text: They can mislead and cause problems

questions.answer: They can mislead and cause problems

questions.question: Why is the ending ironic?
questions.answer: The costly sacrifice was unnecessary

questions.question: What attitude brought Mathilde trouble?
questions.answer: Pride and envy

questions.question: Which word best describes Mathilde at the start?
questions.answer: Discontent

questions.question: Which word best describes Mathilde after the debt?
questions.answer: Determined

questions.question: Why did Mathilde refuse flowers as jewellery?

options.text: She wanted real jewels to impress others

questions.answer: She wanted real jewels to impress others

questions.question: Who suggested borrowing jewellery?
questions.answer: Loisel

questions.question: Who is most responsible for the hardship?
questions.answer: Mathilde herself

questions.question: What lesson does the twist teach?
questions.answer: Value honesty over show

questions.question: Which line proves Mathilde's vanity?

options.text: She wanted so much to charm and be envied

questions.answer: She wanted so much to charm and be envied

questions.question: Why did Loisel search the streets at night?
questions.answer: To find the lost necklace

questions.question: Why did Mathilde avoid Forestier earlier?
questions.answer: Meeting her felt humiliating

questions.question: What transformed Mathilde physically?
questions.answer: Hard physical labour

questions.question: Why didn’t Mathilde tell the truth immediately?
questions.answer: Fear and embarrassment

questions.question: What does the necklace symbolize?
questions.answer: Status and illusion

questions.question: What emotion filled Mathilde at the party?
questions.answer: Triumph and happiness

questions.question: Why did Forestier not recognise Mathilde later?
questions.answer: She looked older and tired

questions.question: Where did they find a replacement?
questions.answer: A shop in Palais Royal

questions.question: Why is Loisel admirable?

options.text: He sacrifices his savings and comfort

questions.answer: He sacrifices his savings and comfort

questions.question: What does Mathilde regret?

options.text: Ruining her life over a necklace

questions.answer: Ruining her life over a necklace

questions.question: How long did it take to repay debt?
questions.answer: Ten years

questions.question: What quality might Mathilde have learned?
questions.answer: Contentment

questions.question: Why is the title appropriate?

options.text: The necklace changes Mathilde’s whole fate

questions.answer: The necklace changes Mathilde’s whole fate

questions.question: Which genre does the story belong to?
questions.answer: Short story with moral

questions.question: Who wrote The Necklace?
questions.answer: Guy de Maupassant

questions.question: Why did Mathilde avoid her rich friend? (Variant 51)
questions.answer: Because visiting her made Mathilde feel jealous and miserable.

questions.question: Why did Mathilde need a new dress? (Variant 52)
questions.answer: She wanted to look beautiful at the grand party.

questions.question: Why did Mathilde cry after the invitation arrived? (Variant 53)
questions.answer: Because she had nothing fancy to wear or jewel.

questions.question: How did Mathilde feel at the party? (Variant 54)
questions.answer: She felt happy, admired and full of confidence.

questions.question: Why did the Loisels return home late? (Variant 55)
questions.answer: They had trouble finding a cab at night.

questions.question: Why did Mathilde panic after the party? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: Because she realized the necklace was missing.

questions.question: What lie did they tell Madame Forestier? (Variant 57)
questions.answer: That the clasp had broken and it was being repaired.

questions.question: How did the couple find a replacement necklace? (Variant 58)
questions.answer: They searched shops and took loans to buy a similar one.

questions.question: How did Mathilde’s life change after losing the necklace? (Variant 59)
questions.answer: She had to do housework and live in poverty for ten years.

questions.question: How did Madame Forestier react at the end? (Variant 60)
questions.answer: She revealed the original necklace was imitation and cheap.

questions.question: Describe how Mathilde’s desire for luxury changes her life. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: Mathilde dreams of being admired and living luxuriously. This desire leads her to borrow the necklace and lie, which eventually forces her into poverty and a life of hard struggle.

questions.question: Explain how losing the necklace affected the Loisel family. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: She and her husband work for ten long years repaying loans. They dismiss their maid, move to a poor home, and suffer hardship until the debt is cleared.

questions.question: Why is the ending of the story surprising and ironic? (Insight 153)
questions.answer: The twist reveals the borrowed necklace was imitation and cheap, while the Loisels spent years repaying a fortune. This irony shows how misunderstanding can destroy lives.

questions.question: Discuss the themes of pride and appearance in the lesson. (Insight 154)
questions.answer: Mathilde wanted to appear wealthy even though she wasn’t. Her pride pushes her into trouble, proving that wanting to impress others is risky and painful.

questions.question: What message or moral do you learn from the story? (Insight 155)
questions.answer: The story teaches us to accept reality, value honesty and avoid pride and jealousy. Happiness does not depend on luxury but on contentment.
